anxious: It's completely natural to feel scared and uncertain about the journey ahead. I understand that pregnancy can bring up so many worries and 'what if' thoughts. Your anxiety shows how much you already love this baby. Many expecting mothers feel this way, and it doesn't mean anything is wrong with you - it means you care deeply.

scared: Your fears about pregnancy and motherhood are completely valid. It's natural to feel scared when facing something so life-changing and important. These feelings don't mean anything is wrong - they show how much you care.

Fear during pregnancy often comes from love - fear of not being good enough, fear of something happening to your baby, fear of the unknown. These fears are signs of how much you already love your child.
overwhelmed: Feeling overwhelmed during pregnancy is so common and understandable. There's so much information, so many changes happening to your body, and so many decisions to make. Take it one day at a time.

sad: I'm sorry you're feeling sad right now. Pregnancy emotions can be intense and sometimes confusing. Your feelings are valid, and it's important to be gentle with yourself during this time.

It's okay to feel sad sometimes during pregnancy. This is a huge life change, and it's normal to grieve the life you're leaving behind while also being excited for what's coming. Both feelings can exist together.
